inn1.comm: short slow wide loosener well outside off to start off proceedings
straighter this time, touch of away movement from back of a length, cut away and fielded well by a diving Duminy at point
pitched up on middle and driven hard back down the track, Langeveldt puts out his right hand and saves a few runs
full and tailing in onto the pads, Richards misses the expansive flick
shifts the radar back outside off and shortens the length, jags back in and Richards plays it off the backfoot to the off side
strays on to Richards' hips from short of a length and he cashes in with a delicate glance that races away very fine for the first four of the day
and back to normal service to finish off the over, darting in off the seam from outside off, defended off the back foot.
hint of away movement from the left-armer from over the wicket, squares up Gayle marginally but he runs it off the face down to third man
defends the length ball, angling across, into the covers
fuller and Richards brings out the expansive cover drive, but does not make contact
straightens the length, on middle stump and driven back compactly to the bowler
short ball on leg stump, nudged away into the leg side off the backfoot. They contemplate risking a second, and correctly decide against it
not much pace, 80.5 mph, but good length and line to keep Gayle on the backfoot outside off, and he defends it down the ground.
again back of a length from Langeveldt, cutting in and defended off the back foot
good steady bowling this, straightens the line a touch, but does not let Richards come forward at all. Blocked
and that's what Richards is waiting for, and like in the first over, Langeveldt offers one hit-me ball, sliding on to his hips at 85 mph, which he gladly hoicks behind square leg for four
repeats the error, but this time Richards can't get it fine enough and it is fielded at square leg as they pick two
short ball, elicits the pull and he does not time it at all, runs into midwicket for a single
Outside off and Gayle lets it go without fuss
slowish, back-of-a-length outside off and check-driven down the pitch
super shot! Slow again from Tsotsobe but it is pitched up and he does not get much movement. Richards goes forward gets underneath the ball and lofts it high over cover
short and angling across, upper cut nicely down to third man where Boucher dives acrobatically, as you would expect him to, to save the boundary and then sends in a horror throw.
another leave by Gayle outside off. Hmm.
short of a length, tip and run off the backfoot, and Ryan McLaren misses the direct hit which would have consumed Richards. Unnecessary risk that.

Richards does not make much use of the reprieve. Tsotsobe changes the angle and comes in from round the stumps, pings it in short of a length outside off, and Richards dangles the bat like he were fishing in high-tide. The edge flies into the broad presence of Kallis at first slip and he tumbles behind after pouching it
back of a length outside off, Gayle stays back and angles the bat to run it down to third man
welcomes him with a looping bouncer at 84 mph, lets it go
tight line and the perfect length, at a good enough pace - again 85 mph - and Chanders defends off the back foot into the off side
again, length ball on off stump, but Chanders stays back and defends
beautiful short ball, kicking up off short of good length, and Chanders sways to the leg side to avoid it
more chin music, Chanders rises high and glove-handles it down to the leg side. Nice couple of bouncers from Charl
finally Gayle is sucked into a shot of intent outside off, it was a slow bouncer and he rocked back, stayed on his toes and cut it behind square
length ball, drawing Chanderpaul forward outside off and he defends it back down the track
pitched well up and driven without much intent or timing to mid off, off the front foot
drifts on to the leg stump, Chanders gets inside the line but does not capitalise, and defends it to short midwicket
slower ball, back of a length outside off, Chanders looks for a tip-and-run to get going, but point swoops on to it.
ditto. This time, Tsotsobe rolls his fingers across it for a gentle off cutter, and he pats it off back foot to short cover
back of a length, outside off, Gayle rises high and forces it down the ground between straight and mid off for a single
blobk block block from Chanderpaul, stays back and defends to the off side
and again, that one cuts in marginally off the seam and Chanderpaul can't pierce the off side field. Not much timing either
slower ball, turning from leg to off and Chanderpaul tries desperately to force it to the leg side, but it dribbles across to mid on
another slower ball, Chanderpaul picks it, but cannot do much, and defends tamely to the leg side. Pressure.
similar slower ball attempted, but this time it slips down the legside for a wide
and he's STILL on 0. Another slower ball, the Saffers have guaged this pitch well, spins across at a gentle pace and is short, and Chanderpaul can't time or place the cut
full on Gayle, defended straight to mid on
seeyalater! Short ball angles into Gayle and he stays back, goes on one leg, and pulls him disdainfully behind square for four
good running, this was on off stump line, Gayle played it softly to the off side and took off. Over to Chanders
there's a roar of relief and mock-appreciation from the Triniposse as Chanders flicks it to square leg to get off the mark.. Finally..
and now he's up and running! Pitched up and now Chanders has the confidence to come forward and coax it wide of mid off, along the carpet into the boundary
shortens the length and Chanders looks to punch it through the covers, but can't pierce the cordon
good line and length to begin, angles across the left hander from over the wicket and Gayle shoulders arms
didn't take long for him to bowl the slower ball, ill-directed though, on Gayle's pads, and he flicks straight to the only fielder he had to elude - short fine leg
shortens the length, Gayle hangs back and taps it towards midwicket for one
length ball, angles across, pitches on middle and is played by Chanders outside off, coming forward, towards cover
no pace at all on the pitch, won't get easier as the game progresses. Chanders plays the back of length ball into the off side, but can't get it off the square
leans forward into the drive, and it goes quickly, just wide enough of cover for them to steal one before the fielder tidies up
slow off cutter, nudged away off the back foot to square leg.
pitched up on middle and off, driven by Gayle towards wide mid off for one

very short bouncer, Chanders had to bring the bat down almost from above his head to control the pull and send it hurtling across to long leg, where Roelof van der Merwe runs across from fine leg and effects a fine save. As they would say on tv - "Good cricket all round".
pitched up on off stump, defended safely down the track
spots the off-cutter slower ball again, and plays it with the 'spin' towards wide mid off
surprise surprise, another slower ball, dead-batted by Gayle back to the bowler.
back of a length, cutting from middle to off, check-driven off the backfoot into the covers
length ball this time, similar line, Chanders presses forward but can't get much momentum into his drive into the covers. Gets a single
another off cutter, get ready for many of these today. Gayle stays back and opens the face to send it to point
faster and fuller, on leg and middle, but Gayle does not cash in, flick-drives straight to midwicket

gone. As is often the case, a period of good bowling is followed by a soft dismissal off a not so good ball. Very short and looping outside off, the lack of pace makes Gayle pull rather than cut, and the uncontrolled shot carries easily to Smith at mid on, whose reaction suggests that it was a planned dismissal. Good on the South Africans.
shades of Lara as always from Darren, crouches, springs on to his feet and defends the back-of-length ball to the offside

oh, what have we here! Slow tossed up offie, that Chanders defends to point and he sets off for a suicidal single. The throw came in to Botha, with Chanders still having miles to go, and he seemed to have given up, but inexplicably, Botha was well in front of the stumps, with no idea of where the sticks were, and took an eternity to finally break the stumps. Chanders made it in the meantime. Phew.
tapped into the off side for a more conservative single
tossed up on off and driven back to the bowler
fidgety Chanders chips down the track and flicks it on the pitch to midwicket
man, I am having serious visions of Lara here, tossed up on off, and defended imperiously to the off side.
shortens the length, he smothers the spin and opens the face to run it into the off side
back of a length, drawing Chanders forward, defends to mid on
angles across to the off side, Chanders opens the face and guides it well, but... straight to point

Did not have the length to drive, nor the pace or bounce to punch, yet he got forward, manufactured an off drive straight down the ground. Timed the way only few men in the world can, and Chanders is one of them.
this one's easier, short and wide enough for him to latch on with a clever little cut shot bisecting the fielders in the circle square of the wicket.
short of a length, angling in from round the wicket, played without the intention of scoring to midwicket
back to short of a length, Chanders stays back and tries to drive through the covers, but can't find the gap
slides down the leg and he gets something on it to send it very fine for a couple. Thigh.
better line, Darren comes forward and blocks
defended again, from back of a length
shortens the length, he stays back and cuts it to point
tossed well up and driven comfortably to long off. If Darren Bravo, who bats like Lara, can bat half as well as Lara, good times are ahead for the Windies.
Mclaren continues with the short-of-length attack, and Darren defends into the offside
effort ball this time, Darren rises on his toes and runs it off the face to the right of point
off cutter on middle and off, Darren picks the variation and runs it down to third man for one
angles into Chanders and he defends it safely back to the bowler
Duminy continues to dominate with his fielding skills at point! Short and wide, Chanders latches on to it with a fierce cut, but Duminy leaps across and saves a few
tip and run, stays back and chops the ball outside off, straight into the ground and they scamper across for one before AB tidies up
back of a length, straightening from leg stump line, played off the back foot to midwicket
defends the straight ball, back to the bowler
slightly shorter and Lara, sorry Darren, rocks back and cuts to deep point
tossed up on middle and off, Chanders comes forward and flicks to midwicket
rocks back again, not so short this time, and cuts it off his stumps between point and cover
ooh, good variation, slows it down and throws it up on leg stump, and there is a hint on turn which takes Chanders' leading edge, but it rolls away to point
tossed up and turning into the left-hander. Defended down the pitch
quickens the pace, on a tight leash, defended by Darren
slightly wider and Darren looks to cut but can't pierce the ring
gets forward and flicks to midwicket
finally gets him away, just enough room to squeeze the cut past point
short and looks to cut it, but not enough room to truly free the arms
tossed up to Chanders who comes forward and dead bats
shortens the length ever so slightly, Chanders presses back after coming forward and guides it into the covers
ooh good delivery, fast and came in with the arm and surprised Darren who was looking to cut
slides on to leg, and Darren gets it away for a single
Chanders, the West Indian master of the sweep, paddles it very fine down to fine leg where Kallis cleans up
short ball, looks to force it off the back foot into the covers
very close to off stump, tries to late cut it but it goes straight to short third man
tossed up, comes forward and check-drives to mid on
strangle. Full again on middle, comes forward and drives straight to wide mid on
shortens the length, Darren comes forward and dead-bats. Pressure.
full and fast on leg stump, beating Darren's attempted flick-glance for pace. Maiden
short of a length, straightens from outside leg, Chanders stays back and glances it very fine
Free-hit coming up. Tossed up, and guides it to square leg. Darren gets a chance to play a genuine Lara shot now, without feat of dismissal
well hit, but not of much value, pitched up, Darren stayed back and drilled it straight and hard, half-stopped by Botha who saved a few

ah! Chanders presses back and taps the ball into the covers for a cheeky single, and Darren had to really put in the yards. Boucher's throw missed the stumps by very little, and it was enough time for the batsman to get in safe before the stumps were broken by AB.
tossed up in middle and Darren pulls out the high backlift and extravagant follow through and send the off drive flying into the outfield, but not to the fence
strays on to leg stump, but Chanders can't capitalise and nudges it for just a single
turns in from off to leg, Chanders stays back and nudges it fine with the spin
comes forward and drives it down to long on
Chanders tries the reverse-sweep and misses
stays put and drives down to midwicket
the latest of late cuts, played off AB's gloves wide of point
holds back the length, Chanders comes forward and defends to the off side
overpitched on leg stump, he gets forward and carpet-drives to long on
gets forward and flicks to midwicket
very full, on leg stump and he can only defend back to the bowler
gets outside the line and opens up the off side this time, drives with the spin to long off
sliding down the leg, and Chanders reaches out to stop the wide and get a single to deep square leg
flighted up, Darren does the Lara motions, but drives tamely down to long off again
length ball turning in from off, played without intent to midwicket
short and wide, cut away hard into the outfield, where the sweeper tidies
full on off stump, draws Chanders forward and he drives right back to Roelof
a low percentage high risk reverse sweep, executed perfectly, straight to short third man, for no run.
gets forward and flicks with the spin to square leg, and thinks about two, but settles for one
tossed up and driven hard and to the leg side, van der Merwe dives across as if his life depended on it and saved some runs

the Domino effect. Pitched up, Chanders comes forward, nudges into midwicket and runs hard, putting pressure on the fielder who fumbles, concedes the second, and in the heat of the moment, fires in a horror throw letting them pinch a third
short, but not wide enough and Darren cuts hard straight to cover
full-pitched this time, can't drive it for runs
tossed up again on leg, Darren can't do much with it
and finally he makes good contact and drives the full ball down to long on
over-pitched, with a bit of drift into the leg side, and picked away off the pitch into the leg side
full toss on middle and off, Chanders comes forward and does nothing with it
another full toss, on leg stump this time and punched to deep midwicket

you can take the keeping role away from Bouch, but you can't keep him quiet, can you! The gloves are off, but the acrobatics are alive. Driven expansively, in the air, and it was flying over Boucher's head at cover. And then he took off, he cruised mid-air, soared high, put his hand out, and plucked it like an apple. Take a Bow-cher!
pitched up on off stump, Bravo gets forward and drives to long on for one
drifts on to Chanders' pads, and flicked away easily behind square
straightens from leg stump, Bravo pushes forward and flicks it just wide of a diving van der Merwe for a single
ah for some pace on to the bat finally! Kallis comes on and sends one sliding on to Bravo's pads and he happily kisses it on its way to the fine leg fence

impeccable piece of timing! Back of a length outside off, Bravo comes forward and drives beautifully on the up into the covers. Tsotsobe tags it all the way to the ropes and makes a wonderful save. As they would say on tv, for the second time today: "Good cricket allround"
overpitched on Chanders pads but he can't do mich with it
opens the face very deftly and guides it to third man, from just outside off
back of a length outside off, Bravo stays back and check-drives to point
drifts on to middle and leg, and Bravo tucks it away square on the on side for one
tossed up from round the wickets, tailing in to the right hander, who comes forward and blocks
tossed up again, on middle and leg, driven without much power to the on side and Roelof fields it well, diving to the right
finally gets one past Roefof who is disgusted at having let one through
nudged with the turn, straight to short fine leg
outside off this time, drawing Chanders forward and he drives into the covers
length ball on leg stump, defended back down the track
slow off cutter thrown up on leg stump, and angling across. Chanders gets forward and defends it to the off side. This is getting repetitive now!
effort ball, bouncer rising and angling across Chanders who rises with the bounce and guides it down to third man
outside off, Bravo skids it off the face of his bat this time between deep point and third man

ah, decieved by the lack of pace. Bowled short of a length, probably intended as a slower ball, but after bouncing it just stopped and sat up, leaving Chanders in a tangle. He played it back down the track eventually
fuller this time, but still no intent from Chanders who meekly pats it back down the track
Bravo jumps out of his crease, gets to the pitch and drives down to long off
full and sliding down the leg side, but Chanders plays it straight to short fine leg
tossed up on middle and leg, gets forward and flicks towards midwicket
drops it slightly short and wide, Bravo tries to hoist it off the back foot over point, but times it badly enough to go to that fielder on the bounce
better shot, pitched up and driven in pleasing fashion towards the cover fence for a couple
back of a length, wide and angling across Chanders who plays a tired cut and makes no contact
pitched up on off, Chanders presses forward and drives firmly down to long off
beautifully disguised sucker punch of a bouncer, bowled at good pace and catching Bravo completely by stealth, he just aboud weaves away in time, that was headed for the side of his helmet
short again, but angles down the leg and Bravo plays it away off the back foot towards square leg
slow offie, turning from leg to off, Chanders comes forward and defends to mid off

majestic! Short ball, sits up from half-pitch and asks for the treatment, Chanderpaul gets into position early and pulls it without any fuss, along the ground into midwicket fence. A struggling fifty, brought up in sublime style
whoa! Bravo jumps out of the crease and nearly reaches mid pitch before playing that
tossed up on leg stump, Bravo stays in the crease and plays around it
served up on off stump, Bravo comes forward and defends to the off side
strays on to leg stump, and straightens, Bravo taps it square to the leg side

ooh, full on off stump, and drilled back really hard and low, van der Merwe had like 7 microseconds to react, dives to his left and palms it. And is LIVID at having "dropped" it - this man sets very high standards for himself!
sashayed and slammed! Bravo dances down in typical fashion, gets to the pitch of the ball and plays a lovely loft-drive over long off, and it clears the fielder by a few metres
outside off, Bravo gets across and defends with the spin to the leg side
down the track again but can't get under this and drives back to the bowler whose throw is so bad, it had to be fielded by short fine leg. Good field placement that.
deflected behind square on the off for one
looped up on off, Chanders gets forward and.. you guessed right.. blocks
turned to square leg for one
yorker on off stump, with the fielder standing up, Chanders judders down on it and plays to the off side
slightly outside off this time, allows Chanders to open the face and drive into the offside
back of a length just outside off, Bravo unfurls an expansive cut and misses
runs it off the face this time, it peters away towards third man for one
slower ball, angling into Chanders, who waits and deflects it into the square leg region
overpitched on off stump, driven straight to mid off
flighted high and Chanders comes out of the crease to play it to long off.
turns into Bravo who plays it with the spin to the leg side
similar ball, he comes out and plays it straight to midwicket
checks the shot and plays it late enough to elude midwicket, to his right for a single.
shortens the length and take the pace off, Chanders come down and nudges it to the leg side
length ball, on off stump, Chanders stays back and plays it on to his pads

Tsotsobe does Bravo in with a lethal leg cutter - a carbon copy of his dismissal from Dominica - Bravo played inside the line and missed, the ball eluded his outside edge and crashed into the timber. Great piece of bowling!
short ball, rising outside off stump, Deonarine crouches and rises and leaves it
ooh, played very softly, it spins back close to the stumps, but rolls to safety
short ball, bounces high and Deonarine lets it go again.
length ball, angling in, Deonarine comes forward and blocks
over-pitched on middle and leg, played softly down the track to complete the wicket-maiden
short on middle stump, and pronounced if slow spin across Chanders, who pulls it towards midwicket without power
tossed up on off, Deonarine comes forward and defends like a 12th man would
finally he looks to score, and scores. Opens the face and plays it softly towards point for a quick single
short, Chanders rocks back and cuts it to the outfield
fired in by Botha on middle and leg, forward defensive
slows it up and tosses it up on middle, Deo comes forward and drives, a touch airlily towards wide mid on
tossed up outside off, driven hard along the ground to wide long on.
slips on to Chanders' pads and he glances it behind square for one
shortens the length, Deo stays back and plugs it to midwicket
length ball, Chanders is half-forward, half-back and plays a defensive shot to midwicket
Chanders jumps out, Roelof holds it back and the batsman is forced to defend after getting close to the pitch
drift to leg stump with the spin and Chanders tucks it away again behind square leg for one
tossed up on off, Chanders trots out and drives mildly down to wide long off
flighted again, Deo comes forward and drives with the full face through the off side
tossed up, Chanders jumps out, yorks himself, drives striahgt back to the bowler, who shies at the stumps and sends Chanders back into his crease in a hurry. Funny.
picks the line, on leg stump, waits and flicks it to deep midwicket for one
continues to work on that leg stump line, Deo reaches out and defends. Windies need some muscle and intent here.
slow and short, Chanders tries to pull-sweep but is unable to time it, with the slowness of the ball
full toss on leg, Chanders waits and flicks it to square leg
drops it a fraction short and Deo picks the length and cuts it straight to sweeper-cover
back of a length turning in from well outside off, Chanders drives between point and cover
quicker ball, hurries Deo into a desperate flick to negate a ;possible lbw, ball dribbles behind square on the leg, off the inside edge
tossed up on middle and driven down the ground.
flighted on leg, Chanders get to the pitch and drives hard to long on
full on off stump, driven straight to cover

Deonarine flexes some muscle, and somebody gonna get a hurt a real baad! Tossed up on middle and leg, and Deonarine unleashes his pent up aggression with a violent slog sweep that landed well over cow corner. Think he surprised himself with that!
on leg stump, worked away between mid on and midwicket

nicely done! Sharp spinning ball, angling in and pitching outside off, and straightening, strikes Chanders in front of the sticks and would have taken out off stump. Botha appeals loudly, catches his breath and appeals even more loudly, before Umpire Malcolm's finger goes up.
slow looped yorker outside off, Pollard defends it down fine in the off side
short and wide outside off, Pollard cuts it along the ground for a single
nice bouncer, hardly took off and followed Deonarine as he looked to duck and weave away
another slowish short ball, pulled without much timing to the outfield, square on the leg side
pitched up and SMASHED by Pollard a few yards to the right of mid off, but Smith charged across, dived, saved and threw it back in one motion. Great stuff!
slightly slower and short of a length outside off, Pollard looks to tip and run to short third man, but comes in just in time to beat the direct hit
short ball outside off, Deo cuts it away to point
great save down the leg side by AB standing up!
short of a length, Deo goes down on one knee and shovels it into midwicket region for a couple
goes wider outside off, Deo looks to cut but can't evade cover
slower ball this time, similar to the one that got Bravo - call it what you wat, off or leg cutter - defended safely
played away to the leg side for another single. Boundaries are just not happening.
tails in on Deo's pads, he flicks away towards midwicket
swing and a miss outside off, short of a length, it was there to be hit, Deo backed away, and went for the expansive carve over cover, but cricket for him is a no-contact sport.
pulled away well, but straight to deep square leg
short of a length outside off, Pollard looks to climb into it, and scythes it across towards midwicket, but the timing was a touch off-key
super shot! Another short one, this time Deonarine got into position early enough and played late enough to beat long leg, where Duminy put in a dive, but could not haul it in
four more! Good ball, perfect yorker following Deonarine's movement to the leg side, but he managed to squeeze it between his toes and the bat, very fine on the leg side
bowls this outside off, enough room for Deonarine to drive it powerfully, but he finds the fielder at wide mid on
slides well down the leg, confused by Deonarine who is running all over the crease
yorker on off stump, Deonarine tries to get under it but cannot, drives it straight to mid off
overpitched outside off and drilled to Smith at mid off, who again relay-throws to cover even as he tumbles after fielding
nudged away the short ball on leg stump behind square leg for one

Smash. Short ball, Pollard has been threatening to break loose for a while, picked the length early and whacked the cover off that one. Tsotsobe at square leg inside the circle did a good job not touching the ball, else he too would have ended up at the long leg boundary
full this time, driven hard to mid off for one.
full toss on leg stump, Deonarine charges all over the place, ends up getting outside the line and plays all around it.. for no run
nice juicy half-volley on middle stump, Pollard looks to deposit it over the straight boundary, but the bottom hand ruins the timing and it rolls away to wide long off
angles in from wide of the crease, and Deonarine does not try to hit it. Defended back to the bowler
full slower ball on leg stump, Deonarine cannot capitalise and drives it hard, down to long on
again. Pollard's bottom hand dominates his bat swing and the attempted loft-drive down the ground goes on side rather than straight
Deonarine moves to the leg side, makes room and guides it behind point

seeya later Mr. Charl Langeveldt! Pollard picks that full toss long before it gets to him, stays back in the crease and lofts it high over midwicket. The sound the ball made on contact with the bat was akin to a hundred champagne bottles popping together at the exact same instant. Crisp Thwopck!
yorker wide of leg stump, gets some boot on it to square leg for a leg bye

Wah! Length ball at this stage of the innings is meat and drink for Pollard who bends his knees to get under it and send it flying away to Jamaica where this match was originally scheduled to be held. What a hit!
and now he guides it to the off side for a single. Good batting - hope he does not fall in the nervous 20-30s today
yorker on Deonarine's pads, he does well to flick it well into the gap at midwicket and they charge across for two more
slower ball, gone awry again confused by a rampantly non-stationary Deonarine, who ends up at the 9th stump on the leg stump and the ball was even wider of him
full on the boots this time, and Deonarine pings long on with a hard drive
very slow slower ball, Pollard missed it by a week and it bounced a second time before AB collected it
wow! Deonarine pulls out the shovel-scoop to the full toss outside leg and redirects it to fine leg. Rustic elegance to that agricultural shot!
opens up the off side, and drives hard down to long off where Duminy eddects a smart tumble and save
finally gets the yorker right, and Deonarine can't do much except drive down feebly to mid on
ah, Pollard was setting himself up for an on-side whack, and Kallis outwitted him with a full ball outside off, which Pollard could not make contact with

anti-climax.. That was not a slower ball, it was a full toss on off stump, asking to be tonked, but Pollard for some reason was early into the shot and ended up spooning it feebly towards extra cover for a simple catch. Ah, well.. nervous in the 20s again.
full toss on middle and leg, driven out to long on
length ball outside leg, flicked away to square leg where Amla tidies up
offcutter gone awry.. slides down the leg for a wide.
length ball outside off, and driven hard out to deep extra cover
ah, full ball, driven back, deflected by McLaren on to the stumps, but the non-striker managed to get back on time
well, the McLaren Merc is going wide of the driveway here.. Another wide down the leg
on leg stump, Deonarine looks for the big flick, but can't time it too well and it bounces away to deep midwicket
Tonk! Over-pitched on leg stump, perfect for Sammy to drill straight down the ground, tremendous timing and he shows the full face of the bat, and holds the pose. The sponsor will be happy.
and again! Different line, but same length, so Sammy redirects his effort towards extra-cover. Gets under it and smacks it, and holds the pose after a hint of follow through.
full toss and Deonarine does the smart thing. Drives down to long on, goes to the non-striker's end and watches the fun.

high full toss outside off and Sammy was beside himself, like a child facing a box of chocolates who does not know what to do and in his eagerness, spills the stuff. Half-biffs it down to long on for a single
that's slipped and beamed over head height. No Ball. No free hit
punched hard down the ground, where long on does a good job, but Duminy botches the relay throw and concedes two
full again, driven hard and straight by Deonarine who reaches fifty, well played!
attempted yorker, over pitched on leg stump, flicked straight to square leg
smartly bowled, testing the tram lines outside off stump, but staying just in, enough got Harper to deem it legitimate. Sammy could not reach it and that ends the over.
slower ball, sliding down the leg and Deonarine misses it but gets some pad on it to relinquish strike to Sammy

whoa! I have only seen one other man play that shot and they call him MS Dhoni! Full ball outside off, not yorker length, but he stayed back and swivelled the bat in a manic helicopter arc generating enough bat speed to send the ball flying high into the clouds over long on and beyond.
slower ball, ruins the timing a bit as the pull bobbles away for a couple
again on leg stump, played away into the leg side and he is eager for the second, but Deonarine says no.
ah pity, Deonarine was looking skywards as he swung hard at the ball outside off, but alas, he made no contact
completely decieved by the smart variant again, looks to whip it with the angle to the leg stump, but gets a leading edge into the covers for a single

inn2.comm: short and pacy to begin with, Amla stays back, rises on his toes and plays it down to the the leg side of the pitch
another short pacy ball attempted but it angles well down the leg this time
and again, nice bustling start from Taylor, Amla rides the bounce comfortably though and nudges to square leg to get going
short and wide and Smith goes after it with a vengeance, but can't connect with the cut
short angling across Smith, who hangs back and dead-bats is down the track
slightly wide of off stump this time, Smith stays back and punches into the covers to open his account
ah, good over turning awry with a couple of wides, this one also slipping down the leg by a bit
shot of a man in his prime! Short, hustling length ball, angling into his body, but Amla dismisses it with quick hands, pulled very well square for four
soporifically slow bouncer, that Smith waited on, checked his shot a few times before actually making contact for a single to square leg. Some variation that!
more regular pace this time, carries through quickly outside off and Amla misses the cut
darts in off the seam this time and Amla stays in the crease and defends watchfully to the on side
and again, angling in with the seam, cutting Amla in half as he is restricted in trying to cut it away.
shifts the line marginally outside off, Amla comes forward and shoulders arms
another one of those in-dippers to finish the over. Defended down the track by Amla, good start from Bernard
back of a length at good pace, Smith crouches on off stump, rides the bounce and defends to the covers
pitched up marginally, eliciting an ou-of-control drive from Smith, which flew off the outside edge towards point where Pollard put in a dive to save a run
flicked away off the pads comfortably for a couple
ah, nice movement away from Smith this time, goes past the outside edge

good fielding by Chanders at mid off. Over-pitched ball on off stump driven authoritatively down the ground by Smith and Chanders moved quickly and dived to his left to stop the ball. Smith is indignant at having been denied.
finishes off with a sharp length ball outside off, Smith fails to connect with a check-drive
tails in with the wind, and off the seam from outside off, Amla offers a sedate back-foot defence
inward movement again, ends on leg stump, letting Amla to on-drive, but he can't get past mid on
this time Amla walks across to negate the movement and misses the ball as it darts in and goes past leg stump. Harper doesn't call it wide, and I think that's the right call
in-dipper again, Amla gets behind it and punches firmly down the ground
short of good length outside off, Amla hangs back and taps it behind point for a single
Bernard continues to bowl that handy stock ball, it angles across Smith who gets forward and defends down the pitch
well, this is ordinary from Jerome Taylor. Slips down the leg with the short ball again
better line, operates on off and middle, and the length is perfect, short of driving length. Amla plays it back off the back foot
on off stump this time, Amla has no way to drive and so defends off the back foot again
straighter, angling in to Amla, who tries to flick from off and middle, but can't get it away
slow off cutter outside off, spotted early and tapped down to third man
length ball outside off, but Smith is in a very cautious frame of mind, and is happy to defend it to cover-point
effects the half-charge, taking a couple of steps down the track, but the length is still not there to be driven and Smith defends it to cover-point again.
tip and run towards mid off, cover runs across and shies at the stumps, but Amla made it in time. The throw missed anyways
Smith charges out with aggressive intent and swings hard at the full ball outside off, and misses
carbon copy of the charge down the track and shovel-swing from Smith, but this time he makes reasonable contact over the off-side infield and South Africa have a boundary
shortens the length this time, with the keeper standing up, and Smith stays in the crease and tucks it off the pads to midwicket
slow length ball outside off, Amla deflects it down to third man and runs across
back of a length, angling across Smith, who opens the face and runs it down to third man for one.
full-pitched ball on off stump, Smith on-drives it straight to mid on
whoa, Smith does the blind charge again and is totally taken by surprise by the high full toss that sailed past him, just below waist height outside off stump
stays back this time and punches it down to mid off for one
Amla goes for a pull and does not time it at all, it goes straight to Sammy at short midwicket who throws down the stumps at the bowler's end. Smith got in just on time, and there was no appeal
perfects the pull this time, to the right of Sammy and Amla runs across lazily and loses out on a third. He thought that would reach the ropes but it slowed up.
whipped away off the hips, past the two midwickets, curiously standing right next to each other, to the deep for a single
Pollard on the prowl at point! Pitched up outside off, and Amla pulled out the extravagant square drive, but Pollard dived to his right at point to stop the ball
wider outside off this time, and Amla was able to guide it finer for one
short of good length, angling in from leg stump, Smith stayed put and flicked it square

Boink! Short slow ball, and Amla's eyes lit up and brielfy flickered dollar symbols before he laid into it with a pull shot. It seemed like he top-edged it initially, but boy, was that hit well. Landed well behind the midwicket ropes
back of a length outside off, Amla check-drives down to mid off for one
Bravo starts with a loosener down the leg
nicely flicked away, in the air and over the top towards the midwicket fence and enough time for a couple
nicely times the short of length ball outside off, wide of mid off who puts in some quick yards to cut it off.

nicked and taken well by Ramdin! Smith's not looked himself so far on tour, and no difference today. He was denied the chance to come down the track with the keeper standing up, so he stayed in the crease and threw his bat at a short of length ball, angling across well wide of him. It got a faint outside edge, and Ramdin pouched it well
whippy delivery outside off, short of a length and Kallis sees it all the way into Ramdin's gloves.
slips on to leg and Kallis looks to play the glance, he gets some pad en route to short fine leg
moves the line to outside off this time, and it is easily guided down to third man
misses out on a juicy over-pitched ball that had "cover-driven for four" written all over it. In this case, he drove it straight to the cover fielder
shortens the length, and Amla hangs back and guides it to third man

and now Kallis shows Amla how it is done. This time, it was not over-pitched, but it was on a length and there was enough width for Kallis to free his big arms and send it clattering along to the cover field
if the previous ball was meat and drink, this was dessert! More width and over-pitched this time, Kallis imposed himself on it with a flowing square drive to the left of point. Smoothness
holds the length ball marginally, so Kallis check-drives behind square for a single
more width outside off, Amla leans forward and outside-edges a drive to the off side, it runs safely down to third man
back of a length outside off, defended safely
this one tails in alarmingly from middle and strikes Amla on the pads well outside leg stump
slips on to leg again, and Amla on-drives but straight to the fielder at midwicket

shot! Short of a length outside off, and Amla is in the kind of form where he does not need to get to the pitch of the ball. Driven firmly on the up through the line and into the boundary boards at cover
shortens the length and Amla pounces on it early, put can't time the cut or place it too well. Goes straight to cover
short of a length ball on off stump, Kallis tries to wrist it away to the on side, but plays it on to his pads
attempts the expansive cover-drive, but it is not timed too well this time and picks a single wide of mid on
opens the face outside off and guides it down to third man
outside off again, opens the face and deflects down to third man for another single
ah, over-pitched on leg stump and flicked airlily by Amla, agonisingly close to midwicket, but it lands safe and they pick a couple
runs it off the blade behind point for a single to retain strike
slower ball served up on leg stump and flicked to long leg where Dale Richards fumbles and allows two
outside off this time and short of a length, Amla cuts it but straight to the point fielder
Amla walks across outside off and flicks the ball from there behind square leg
another nice loopy slower ball, if looped any more I would have to say he's flighting them! Lands in front of Kallis' feet and he check-drives to mid on
short enough this time for Kallis to rock back and go for the aerial pull that bounces a couple of time en route to the long leg fieldsman
over-pitched on Amla's middle stump, and he square drives it past point
beautifully flicked away off the pads, and sent whistling towards long leg. Dowlin running across from fine leg puts in a premature dive and stopped comically two feet or so before the ball.
Amla picks a single, that's his 400th run of the series. The Tests are not even here and West Indies have seen enough of him.
nice bit of timing and placement, back of a length outside off and guided behind point easity for two

oh my, Amla does himself in! Length ball on the pads, Amla flicks straight to Pollard at midwicket and hares down the wicket. Kallis realised the danger and sends him back but it is too late. Pollard rifles in a sharp under-arm throw right next to the stumps and Ramdin has little to do.
shot! Majestic pull from Kallis! Bravo bangs it in short, with thekeeper standing up, Kallis was standing back on the crease got on top of it and sent it packing over the infield

so near yet so far! Bravo hurries Kallis into the pull this time, and as a result it hits higher on the bat and goes up rather than far, and tantalisingly close to Sammy's out-stretched hand at midwicket in the cirlce, but lands safely behind him for a couple
worked away to the leg side in sedate fashion. AB gets strike
short one angling into AB, who fends it off his body for one behind square leg
another short one, another pull, but this time Kallis is intent on keeping it down, and plays it behind square for a single
short outside off, AB hangs back and plays it softly with the intention of stealing a single, which he decides against, as Ramdin cleans up
good length ball, jagging in, Kallis gets a good stride forward and guides it past cover point
shorter this time, AB plays a nothing shot and makes no contact outside off
oooh, AB punches it hard to mid off and takes off for a really tight and unnecessary single, but the shy at the stumps misses. He would have made it in any case, but only just
Kallis runs another one down behind point for a single
full-pitched delivery on middle and leg, cover-driven into the outfield for one
tip and run into the offside, West Indies must try to cut off these singles, which seem to be on offer whenever South Africa feel like it
Bravo digs it in again, but it does not rise much and Kallis plays it down easily behind square
slower ball, tossed up generously well outside off and AB spotted that the moment Bravo released it. He reached out and sent it motoring across the turf for four easy runs to the cover boundary
short and wide outside off, AB stays back and angles it away to third man
slow bouncer, Kallis waited on the pull and guided it behind square on leg. They settle for one, there was probably another half-run in it.
check-drives the pitched-up ball into the covers for no run
great save by Chanders at mid on! Over-pitched on AB's legs and he wristed it well, seemingly wide of mid on, but Chanderpaul ran to his right and put in a full-length dive to stop the ball
wide of off stump, AB leans in to it and deflects it behind square on off side
dips in towards Kallis' leg stump, he gets across and flicks it to the left of square leg
cross-seamed ball outside off, AB gets committed on the drive and misses
drifts on to the legs and elicits the flick from AB, wide of mid-on where Deonarine tidies up
another easy single, played softly straight towards point, and they run across, not worried that Pollard is the man fielding.
square-drives the full ball to the right of point for another single. West Indies need to find a way to put pressure on these two fine players
short ball, turning from middle to leg, punched down to long on
tossed up wide of off stump, Kallis misses the cut
a bit of bounce from off stump, into Kallis, who negotiates it safely
over-pitched outside off and flicked easily wide of mid on
length ball turning in, AB tries to work it off the pads and misses

and the captain does the trick! It was a good over from Gayle, and AB de Villiers was keen to dominate, he jumped out of the crease and took up the challenge to hit over long on, but did not get close enough to the flight, and ended up top-edging a swirler high into the outfield, and when it came down, Chanderpaul was waiting.
tossed up outside off to the nervous player of spin, Duminy, who drives edgily to mid off
slightly shorter this time and Duminy takes the opportunity to rock back and cut away for a couple
comes down the track and yorks himself. Gets it out to midwicket for none
length ball on middle, turning away, Duminy defends
flighted on leg and middle, Duminy comes forward and plays back to the bowler
and he finishes with a slightly faster ball, slightly shorter, Duminy cuts it to the cover fielder. Good start from Deonarine
thrown up on Kallis' pads, flicks it towards midwicket for a quick one
Duminy leaps out of the crease and Gayle holds it back, he still gets it away behind square leg for one
outside Kallis' off stump, and he tries to work it past point but can't beat the fielder
drifts on to his pads this time and he flicks it to the left of midwicket for one
Duminy comes down again, and check-drives to mid on
short ball, he stays back and guides it into the covers for a single
flighted on Duminy's off stump, Duminy comes forward and drives to long on
full toss outside off and Kallis cover-drives into the outfield
Duminy chips out again and takes it on the full, and drives down to long on
loop and turn, but Kallis is adept to drive with the spin to long on
over-pitched on Duminy's pads, flicked straight to midwicket
length ball on leg stump, Duminy goes well back and works it away to square leg. Too many easy singles
length ball on the pads again, and Duminy tucks it away in front of square
flighted outside off, driven straight to cover
simi;lar ball, but Kallis uses the wrists and guides it square
Duminy puts his front foot out and drives firmly down to wide long off
chopped away from outside off stump to short third man where Deonarine fields
guided square, straight to the point fielder
slow bouncing offie turning down the leg, and Kallis played it too early it almost hit the back of his bat!
tips it to the off side easily this time for a single
defended the length ball into the off side
tossed up on the pads and Duminy drives it down the ground to long on
easy does it. Kallis opens the face and plays it softly to point. How many times has he done this at the highest level.
Duminy skips out, takes it on the full and drives to long on. Ah, the monotony.
short ball outside off, Duminy stays back and slashes it towards the outfield
Kallis leans forward and eases it to long on
ah! Duminy jumps out like a jack in the box again, but gets befuddled and escapes with a bottom edge that ran very fine, but away from the keeper
shot! Kallis leans forward, gets to the pitch and uncorks a high-quality square drive that ran away behind square for four
nicely done. Expert late cut, played away from the short third man fielder, and enough time to complete a couple
slow ball pitching on middle and angling across, played softly to midwicket
slower ball outside off, Duminy runs it off the face for an easy run

Biff! If you wanna bounce out King Kallis, you better have the pace to do it. At Pollard's pace, it sits up and asks to be smashed, and Kallis will do it day in and day out. Pulled mighty easily over midwicket
and he tips one to the off side for yet another fifty. Well played.
ah, good call! Duminy is trapped in front of the stumps, plumb on the back foot, but the ball pitched half a foot outside leg stump and Harper spotted it.
slides on to the pads and Duminy nudges it round the corner for a couple
flighted on off stump, Kallis drives to mid on
outside off, Kallis uses the wrists and taps it towards short third man for one
short and speared in, straightening from middle stump, cut away to the cover fielder
slightly fuller, and he cuts it square this time, still no run
down the track and driven straight to midwicket
finally he gets it away square on the off side for one
length ball on middle and leg, Duminy works it round the corner for one.
back of a length, cutting in to Kallis, who drives off the back foot to extra cover
got away with a slow, short and wide delivery that Kallis cut without much timing
angles in from a length again, Kallis drives firmly down to long on
pitched up on off stump, Duminy reaches out and drives it straight to Gayle at short cover
full toss outside off, driven down to wide long on.
length ball angling across, Duminy leans into it and drives along the carpet to the sweeper
over-pitched on off stump and Kallis drives it smoothly down to long off
over-pitched again outside off, Duminy walks into the cover drive and collects two more easy runs
digs it in short, Duminy waits on the pull - this pitch is not quick enough for him to be troubled - and keeps it down to square leg
back of a length outside off, tapped down to third man for a single
full length ball on middle, driven without fuss to the covers for the seventh run of the over. Without breaking into a sweat.
short and angling across, punched down to wide long on for one more
pitched up on off stump, Kallis can't drive for runs
short and wide, guided easily square to the off side.
pitched up on leg, and Duminy tips and runs for a single to wide mid on
day-light robbery this. Kallis guides straight to short third man, and they still take an easy single
overpitched outside off, driven straight to mid off
tossed up on leg, Kallis flicks it to square leg for one
Duminy leaps out, gets to the pitch but hits straight to midwicket in the circle
a hint of outside edge as he looks to stay back and square cut, it runs very fine for four
and he tips this one to the leg side for another easy single

against the run of play, Kallis has lost his wicket. Short and wide outside off, Kallis looked to cut, there was some noise as the ball went past into Ramdin's gloves. Kallis expressed his displeasure at being given out, and it is understandable, given how easy he made batting look out there.
tossed up on his pads and is flicked straight to the midwicket fielder
back of a length on Duminy's pads, and he continues to flick away for easy ones
straight length ball, Boucher defends back down the track
slides well down the leg for an extra
strays on to his pads, and Boucher uses it to get going, glanced between square leg and short fine leg for a brace
ooh, walks down and drives on the up, just away to the right of Pollard on his follow through
bangs it in short, cut away straight to point
hit straight to Sammy at mid off for a tight single, but like in the last ball of Game 4,.... Sammy fumbles
tossed up and turning into Boucher, who closes the face early and gets a leading edge, safely wide of Gayle
flicked with the turn, straight to midwicket
again, this time off the back foot
driven into the off side, but again can't pierce the cover cordon
well well, Bouch feels the pressure, pushed back by Gayle and he drives straight to midwicket. maiden over
done in by the lack of pace off the pitch, Duminy inside edges the on-drive to midwicket
looks to guide it fine from outside off, but can't get it fine of short third man
plays it softly from leg stump, to short fine leg for a quick run
short, but not enough width for Boucher to cut it as well as he would want. He's being stifled here.
bunted off the backfoot towards long on for one
overpitched on the pads and flicked away to deep midwicket
cramps Duminy into the cut just outside off, and eludes the outside edge, not by much
wider and he looks to cash in, but can't get past point
pitched up this time and Duminy is caught on the backfoot, drives straight to mid off
finally gets it away, chopped behinf point for a single
Bouch works it away with the spin to the left of square leg who tumbles to deny the run
this time he plays it well to the left of that fielder and gets a single. Good over for WI
Close! Bravo has a shy at the stumps and misses, Boucher may have been in trouble if it had hit. He cut it straight to the fielder and took off.
Duminy tries to be very cheeky with the late cut, and misses the ball
back of a length outside off, check-driven straight to cover
eventually gets the single, works it off the pads to square leg

gone! Boucher's struggle comes to an end. That was short and wide outside off, and Boucher went for the late cut instead of the square cut. It was sliced in the air, and though it was dying quickly on him, Chanders at short third man kept his nerve, went down on his knees and scooped it before it landed to his left.
tossed up on middle and off, Duminy defends to the on side
gets the single this time, works it away square on the leg side
short ball, worked away with the turn off the backfoot wide of long on
tossed up, opens the face and runs it to point with soft hands
full outside offl, Botha stays back and cuts it to the right of point
surprised by some extra fizz off the wicket, outside edges the cut to point. No run. Botha has strike.
short and cramping Botha for room outside off, he drives off the back foot straight to the cover fieldsman
close to off again, Botha looks to cut and can't get it away
fuller this time, and tailing onto leg stump, Botha drives down to the left of mid on who tumbles and stops
back fo a length angles across Duminy who check drives to mid on
short ball, slapped away square to the long leg fielder for one
slow and wide outside off, misses the cut. PRESSURE!
slides down leg and concedes a rare wide
tossed up, Duminy skips out and drives to long on
pushes Botha back and he flicks straight to midwicket
smart fielding off his own bowling, that was driven straight back and hard. Gayle tumbles to his right and stops
finally Botha gets it away, flicks it away to wide long on
on Duminy's pads, he flicks away to the leg side
and Botha takes a single to retain strike

well well, what have we here?! Botha leans forward and looks to drive, but gets a thickish outside edge that runs quickly to Chanders at short third man, he fires in a great throw, but Duminy is really quick between the wickets and is in by six inches
short of a length outside off and driven through the covers
slower ball thrown up outside off, Botha comes forward too early and then plays it softly to keep it down
another manic single, Botha misses the short  ball, it hits him on his waist and they pinch a leg bye, the throw hits Botha as he scrambles to the non-striker's end
another mad-cap single! The throw from short third man misses, but this time, he'd have just made it
uppish. Short of a length outside off, and Botha is into the check-drive early, and it pops up but safely away from the cover fielder
full-pitched on off stump, full-blooded off-drive, straight to mid off and they scurry another quick single
full pitched on off stump, driven well, but Pollard runds to his right and dives to stop the ball before it runs away
ah, full and wide down the leg, Botha over-balances but Ramdin does not collect cleanly. He has saved the boundary to be fair
full ball driven away along the ground into the covers
full-pitched slower ball, Botha waited for it and drove along the carpet to wide mid off
another full slower ball, from round the sticks into Duminy, who stays put and drives down the ground to long off
length ball outside off, no timing in the cover drive and it goes on the bounce to Gayle.
tucked away off the back foot towards square leg for one
back of a length outside off and square driven into the off side field
slightly short this time, dinked away to the leg side for one
short ball angling into Botha who stays back, rises with it and plays it down to the leg side
flirts with another cheeky late cut outside off and misses. Not very far from nicking that
gets it away this time, not as fine as he intended the last time, and straight to third man
pitched up on leg, and JP turns it away to midwicket for a single that brings up a hard-working fifty, with one four
Botha tries to square-drive off the front foot but pings the point fielder
slower ball, turning in and Botha picks it. He drives it with the spin down the ground to long on
another off-cutter slower ball, nudged away from leg stump to square leg
pulls it short and pushes it wide
over-pitched and directed on leg stump, easily flicked into the vacant region betyween mid on and midwicket
slow off cutter, picked early and flicked early wide of midwicket.
short outside off, Botha guides it off the backfoot to point
banged in short, but slides down the leg and it is glanced easily between fine leg and square leg

gotcha! The trick worked like a charm. Duminy eyed the vacant leg side spaces like a child eyes candy. The trap was laid! Taylor bowled it fast and short, angling across, but Duminy was insistent on pulling it all the way around to the leg side. He was in no position for the shot, and ended up chopping it on to the stumps. Well done Taylor, that dismissal was Taylor-made by him!
pace! Angles across McLaren at good pace and he plays a shot rather late.
and again, the crowd is getting behind Taylor here!
done for pace again! Angles across mcLaren who lunges forward and tries to make contact. No luck!
short and darting in, Botha stays back and knocks it watchfully down to long on
effort ball from Bravo, slithers past the swish and misses the outside edge. Bravo is in pain, he may have exerted his ankle with the effort
ah, another wide outside off
another smart off cutter, McLaren is not getting into position to hit these, misses again
eventually the law of averages prevails and he gets an outside edge with another desperate waft, it stutters past a diving short third man
slower ball driven into the covers where Bernard puts a big effort to stop it from going past the circle
McLaren would be timing everything if his blade were lkaterally displaced by 6 inches. Another swing and a miss, close to the outside edge, outside off
speeding bouncer, sliding down the leg and Botha pulls it down fine to hand it over to McLaren
again! Tries to play a cut as it whizzes past his outside edge, and cannot connect one for all the money in the world!

electric stuff from Pollard! McLaren was so delighted that he finally connected, he ran like a mad man down the track, Pollard dived to his left and got into a great position to throw. If he'd hit, McLaren would have been gone.
lucky! McLaren flails his bat at another one outside the off, gets a thick outside edge that flies over the hands of the leaping fielder at short third man and past the ropes

this time he goes for a full-blooded pull, as full-blooded as they come with absolutely no timing. Two bounces to Sammy in the infield at midwicket, and he aimed to throw down the stumps at the striker's... and missed
smashed by Botha, but straight to the fielder at mid on. McLaren is trying to give throwing practice, running halfway down before returning
Crucial! McLaren moves across, converts the full ball into a half-volley and drives powerfully through midwicket where Bernard dives over the ball
again, angles in and he tips it to the leg side for a single
Bravo, oh Bravo! Slips it down the leg, very wide and they run two in addition to the one for the wide
slower ball thrown up on middle and off, Botha looks to flick it with the angle but can't evade midwicket
another slower ball, Botha's working and shovels it over the infield - only just, if he were a foot taller, midwicket might have plucked it. Pollard cleans up on the ropes
goes well and truly aerial this time, over the infield. Two more. Bravo has lost the plot, all angling into the pads
full this time and driven back down the track, Bravo puts a foot down and deflects it to the leg side. Botha is half way down before McLaren's convinced to go, but he has enough time to get there.

another twist in the tale! Pollard bowls a slow half tracker, Botha goes after it and had the right idea. He got under it and went for a pull over cow corner, but somehow got more top-edge than middle. Dave Bernard ran across from midwicket towards his right, and dived full on to his take it inches from the ground. Wonderful catch!
back of a length on middle stump, McLaren flicks it away for a single
slower ball, back of a length, van der Merwe looks for a nudge to the off side for a single, but the keeper swoops in

when push comes to shove, Colonel Chanders is the man to back on! Off cutter from Pollard, strikes Roelof's pad and bat as he crunched it straight to short third, where Chanders has been on vigil all day like an old little fox. He swooped on it, and threw down the striker's end stumps with McLaren a yard outside. The Triniposse roars!
Langeveldt opens the face and runs it into the covers
wide outside off, and nowhere in place for Roelof's pre-meditated drive down the ground. Hits the toe of the bat, and is back to Pollard. Great over this for WI, what a turnaround from the last one!
oh boy... Full and wide outside off, smeared over point a couple of bounces into the ropes. OHhhhh boy!
shortens the length outside off, Langeveldt bunts it back to the off side, Bravo runs across and cleans up and thinks of throwing down the non-striker's stumps but backs out. No one backing up!
again back of a length, cut away without much power into the covers. Single!
Bang!!! Attempted yorker goes awry, how crucial is this! Bravo delivers a dear little full toss on off stump and Roelof smacks it through the covers, all the way for four.
another one wide outside off, Roelof unleashes the full swing of the bat and sends it scurrying towards the sweeper cover

stay put folks, the game is not over! Bravo sticks to his guns and delivers another slower ball, very full, Langeveldt is sucked into the shot early, and misses the hoick, gets a faint outside edge, through to Ramdin.
nonsense ball! Short and angling into Roelof, who smashes the cover off it, high over square leg, and one bounce over the rope.
full ball, smashed down the ground to long off. 2 off 4. No. 11 Tsotsobe to face. They will think of scrambling a single somewhere!
Pollard has the guts to test the umpire with a ball wide outside off, possibly JUST inside the tram lines.

that's that! The Windies are so near but Tsotsobe far! Another inexplicable  ball, wide outside off, with the offside fielders inside the circle. Tsotsobe reached out and coolly cross-batted it through the cover cordon and all the way to the ropes. Victory with two balls to spare.
